monsters.name: Aboleth
monsters.description: Enormous, antediluvian catfish covered in slime and tentacles. They hate all intelligent beings.
monsters.actions: Curse. DC 15 CON or target gains deep one over 2d10 days. Enslave. In place of attacks, one aboleth controls for 1d4 rounds. Telepathic. Read the thoughts of all creatures within far.

monsters.name: Acolyte
monsters.description: A religious trainee who knows basic rites and rituals.
monsters.actions: Healing Touch (WIS Spell). DC 11. Heal one creature within close for 1d4 HP.

monsters.name: Angel, Seraph
monsters.description: Beautiful, luminous humanoids with white-feathered wings.
monsters.actions: Bless. 3/day, touch one target to give it a luck token.

monsters.name: Angel, Domini
monsters.description: Winged, flawless humans glowing with bronze sunlight.
monsters.actions: Horn. All enemies in near DC 15 CHA or paralyzed 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Angel, Principi
monsters.description: Serene humans sculpted from alabaster. Golden orbs for eyes.
monsters.actions: Moonlight Aura. Hostile spells targeting the principi are DC 15. Truesight. Can see all invisible creatures and objects.

monsters.name: Archangel
monsters.description: A radiant being with a crown of fire, snowy wings, golden armor, and a blazing greatsword.
monsters.actions: Command. DC 18 CHA to resist an archangel's command. Crown of Fire. Hostile spells extreme (DC 18) to cast.

monsters.name: Ape, Snow
monsters.description: White-haired, carnivorous gorillas that stalk the high mountains and live in caves.
monsters.actions: Thick Fur. Cold immune.

monsters.name: Ape
monsters.description: Hooting, omnivorous apes that live in trees.

monsters.name: Ankheg
monsters.description: Horse-sized, rust-brown insects. They burrow vast, underground warrens into the bedrock.

monsters.name: Animated Armor
monsters.description: An old suit of armor magically animated by a vengeful spirit.
monsters.actions: Statue. When standing still, looks exactly like a suit of armor.

monsters.name: Apprentice
monsters.description: A cloaked magician with a thin, freshly bound spellbook.
monsters.actions: Beguile (INT Spell). DC 11. Focus. is stupefied for the duration. Magic Bolt (INT Spell). DC 11. 1d4 damage to one target within far.

monsters.name: Archmage
monsters.description: A wizened magic-user crackling with arcane power.
monsters.actions: Death Bolt (INT Spell). DC 15. near DC 15 CON or go to 0 HP. Enervate (INT Spell). DC 14. Focus. One target within near is stupefied for the duration. Fireblast (INT Spell). DC 14. 4d6 damage to all within a near\u0002sized cube within far. Float (INT Spell). Self. DC 14. Fly double near for 5 rounds. Mithralskin (INT Spell). Self. DC 14. AC becomes 18 for 5 rounds. Void Step (INT Spell). Self and up to 4 willing targets. DC 15. Teleport up to 100 miles.

monsters.name: Assassin
monsters.description: A black-cloaked, skulking killer.
monsters.actions: Execute. Deals x3 damage against surprised targets.

monsters.name: Azer
monsters.description: Dwarves with bronze, metallic skin and flames in place of hair. Gifted blacksmiths.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Fire immune.

monsters.name: Badger
monsters.description: Fierce, clawed burrowers with black-and-white face stripes.
monsters.actions: Rage. 1/day, immune to morale checks, +1d4 damage (3 rounds).

monsters.name: Bandit
monsters.description: Hard-bitten rogue in tattered leathers and a hooded cloak.
monsters.actions: Ambush. Deal an extra die of damage when undetected.

monsters.name: Basilisk
monsters.description: Massive, muscled lizards with six legs and gray, tough hide.
monsters.actions: Petrify. Any creature that gaze, DC 15 CON or petrified.

monsters.name: Bat, Giant
monsters.description: Leathery, eagle-sized mammal with a taste for flesh.

monsters.name: Bat, Swarm
monsters.description: A whirling cloud of screeching, bloodthirsty bats.

monsters.name: Bear, Brown
monsters.description: A hulking, swaying brute with claws as long as a finger.
monsters.actions: Crush. Deals an extra die of with both claws.

monsters.name: Bear, Polar
monsters.description: A mighty, white bear that thrives in arctic environments.
monsters.actions: Crush. Deals an extra die of with both claws. Thick Fur. Cold immune.

monsters.name: Beastman
monsters.description: A cave hominid with scraggly fur and a stone-tipped spear.
monsters.actions: Brutal. +1 damage with melee weapons (included).

monsters.name: Berserker
monsters.description: Howling, battleraging warriors.
monsters.actions: Rage. 1/day, immune to morale checks, +1d4 damage (3 rounds).

monsters.name: Boar
monsters.description: Ornery wild pig with bristly, russet hair and yellowed tusks.
monsters.actions: Gore. Deals an extra die of with both tusks.

monsters.name: Black Pudding
monsters.description: A black, ice-cold mass of sludge.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Only damaged by fire. Corrosive. Wood or metal that d6 roll of 1-3.

monsters.name: Brain Eater
monsters.description: Purple, gaunt humanoids with squidlike heads and four face tentacles. They live in complex, alien societies underground and eat humanoid brains.
monsters.actions: Hear Thoughts. Can hear the creatures within near. Latch. Tentacles attach to hit remove 1d4 tentacles). If all four devoured. Mind Blast. Fills a near-sized cube extending from brain eater. paralyzed 1d4 rounds. Mind Control. One target in near for 1d4 rounds.
monsters.attackText: 4  tentacle +5 (1d8 + latch) or 1 mind  blast or 1 mind control

monsters.name: Bugbear
monsters.description: Brutish, bat-eared goblinoids covered in brown fur.
monsters.actions: Stealthy. ADV on checks to sneak and hide.

monsters.name: Bulette
monsters.description: A hulking, shark-sized lizard with a steely, arrow-shaped carapace and a massive gullet.
monsters.actions: Leap. Jump up to near in height then make 2 bite attacks.

monsters.name: Camel
monsters.description: Ornery, tan-furred desert beasts.

monsters.name: Cave Brute
monsters.description: A hulking, insectoid beast with long mandibles, four eyes, and thick arms covered in bristles.
monsters.actions: Bewilder. Creatures within near or dazed and no action.

monsters.name: Cave Creeper
monsters.description: Chittering, green centipedes the size of horses. Their grasping tentacles are coated in a paralytic venom.
monsters.actions: Toxin. DC 12 CON or paralyzed 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Centaur
monsters.description: Herd-dwelling beings with the upper body of a human and lower body of a horse.

monsters.name: Centipede, Giant
monsters.description: Blood-red, feathery centipedes the size of a human arm. Their bite injects a burning poison that cramps muscles.
monsters.actions: Poison. DC 12 CON or paralyzed 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Centipede, Swarm
monsters.description: A crawling mass of weaving, sinuous centipedes.
monsters.actions: Poison. DC 12 CON or paralyzed 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Chimera
monsters.description: A monstrous beast with a half-goat, half-lion body, wide dragon wings, and the heads of a goat, lion, and dragon.
monsters.actions: Fire Breath. Fills a near-sized cube extending from chimera. DC 15 DEX or 4d6 damage.

monsters.name: Chuul
monsters.description: Brown, horse-sized lobster bugs with tentacles and pincers.
monsters.actions: Grab. DC 15 STR or held in pincer. DC 15 STR on turn to break free.

monsters.name: Cloaker
monsters.description: A midnight blue manta ray with a bony tail and crescent-shaped maw above its belly. It swoops through deep, lightless caverns.
monsters.actions: Phantoms. 1/day, in place of attacks. Create 3 illusory hit. Determine randomly if an attack hits cloaker or illusions. Screech. Enemies within double attacks and checks 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Cockatrice
monsters.description: A molting, lizard-chicken hybrid with a crimson, razorlike crest.
monsters.actions: Petrify. DC 12 CON or petrified.

monsters.name: Couatl
monsters.description: A human-sized snake with scales made of jewels and a corona of iridescent feathers.
monsters.actions: Change Shape. In place of similarly-sized creature. Poison. DC 15 CON or fall into natural, deep sleep for 1d8 hours. Restore. In place of attacks, curse, affliction, or heal 3d8 HP.

monsters.name: Crab, Giant
monsters.description: A wagon-sized, armored crab with two crushing pincers.
monsters.actions: Crush. DC 15 STR or target takes 1d8 damage.

monsters.name: Crocodile
monsters.description: Fat, scaly reptiles with stumpy legs and long, thrashing tails.

monsters.name: Cultist
monsters.description: A cloaked, wild-eyed zealot chanting the guttural prayers of a dark god.
monsters.actions: Fearless. Immune to morale checks. Deathtouch (WIS Spell). DC 12. within close.

monsters.name: Cyclops
monsters.description: Reclusive, one-eyed giants towering 20' high. They live simply on remote farmlands.

monsters.name: Darkmantle
monsters.description: A floating, black octopus with rows of red eyes and a webbed skirt of tentacles.
monsters.actions: Darkness. Extinguish all light sources in near.

monsters.name: Deep One
monsters.description: Cultish, amphibious fish-people with bulbous eyes. They lurk in deep water and sunless caverns.
monsters.actions: Sunblind. Blinded in bright light.

monsters.name: Demons
monsters.description: Demons are Chaos incarnate, born from the violent roil and madness of the Dark Realms. They watch from the liminal space between worlds, hoping to find a way into the Light Realms to wreak destruction. Most demons are utterly unique in their powers and can take any form. However, some lesser demons share a common appearance and set of abilities. The most recognized of these lesser demons are listed here.

monsters.name: Demon, Balor
monsters.description: Colossal, horned bat-beasts wreathed in the flames of hell itself. Their mighty swords and cracking whips of fire can slice through stone.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Fire immune. Only damaged by magical sources. Grab. DC 18 STR or target bound in whip. 2d6 damage per round free. In place of fire whip attack, double near on its turn. Hellfire. DC 18 DEX or 2d8 extinguished.
monsters.attackText: 3 greatsword  +10 (2d12 + hellfire) and 1 fire  whip (near) +10 (2d6 + grab)

monsters.name: Demon, Glabrezu
monsters.description: Horse-headed, fanged creatures who walk upright and have four arms; two shriveled, and two ending in hulking pincers.
monsters.actions: Crush. DC 15 STR or target takes 2d8 damage.

monsters.name: Demon, Dretch
monsters.description: Green, pig-faced demons with thick claws and an oily stench.
monsters.actions: Gas. All in near DC 12 CON or blinded for 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Demon, Marilith
monsters.description: Hissing, armored women with six limbs and the lower bodies of giant snakes. Six whirling blades flash in their hands.
monsters.actions: Parry. Trade 2 longsword attacks attack that would hit.

monsters.name: Demon, Vrock
monsters.description: Wagon-sized, filthy vultures with four limbs, midnight-blue skin, and a rash of mangy feathers.
monsters.actions: Carrion Mist. Each time vrock vrock. All enemies DC 15 CON or violent vomiting 1d4 rounds. Screech. All enemies in double rounds.

monsters.name: Devils
monsters.description: Devils are the vile reflection of angels, forming the unholy hosts of chaotic gods and sovereign archdevils. Their endless wars rage across the blasted layers of hell, fed by the constant influx of evil souls that turn into devils. Tiny imps and beautiful cubi secure humanoid souls with promises of power or delight. Barbed and horned devils are hell's cruel soldiers; darkly angelic erinyes are its generals. Wicked archdevils rule over all.

monsters.name: Archdevil
monsters.description: A stunningly beautiful, horned human with burning, red eyes and a halo of seven black stars. Two stitched-up gashes weep blood from its shoulder blades.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Fire immune. Only damaged by magical sources. Crown of Darkness. All hostile a spellcasting check less than 20. Soulbind. All targets within near of archdevil for 1d4 rounds. DC 20 CHA on turn to end the effect.

monsters.name: Devil, Barbed
monsters.description: Lanky, green-mottled fiends bristling with hooked spines.
monsters.actions: Barb. Each spine sticks, dealing 1d4 damage each round. DC 12 STR check on turn to remove.

monsters.name: Devil, Cubi
monsters.description: Entrancing humanoids with bat wings and devilish charm.
monsters.actions: Change Shape. In place of similarly-sized humanoid. Charm. One humanoid in near for 1d6 hours. Drain. The target takes 1d6 WIS damage. A target reduced to 0 an archdevil.

monsters.name: Devil, Erinyes
monsters.description: Raven-winged, resplendent beings in polished, black armor and helms with curved horns.
monsters.actions: Poison. DC 15 CON or target's its allies for 1d4 rounds. DC 15 WIS on turn to end effect.

monsters.name: Devil, Horned
monsters.description: Iron-scaled hellions as big as ogres with weighty ram horns, lashing tails, and leathery wings. They are opportunistic and craven in battle.
monsters.actions: Iron Hide. Half damage from non-magical weapons.

monsters.name: Devil, Imp
monsters.description: Cat-sized, red devils with oversized wings and tail, tiny horns, and cowardly demeanors.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Fire immune. Contract. Can grant mighty a sworn soul. ADV on related Charisma checks. Poison. DC 12 CON or fitful sleep for 1d4 hours.

monsters.name: Pterodactyl
monsters.description: Long-beaked beasts with wide, triangular wings. Large enough to carry off a human.
monsters.actions: Grab. DC 15 STR or held. DC 15 STR on turn to break free.

monsters.name: Tyrannosaurus
monsters.description: Towering, bipedal lizards with a massive head, jaws, and neck.

monsters.name: Triceratops
monsters.description: Plodding herbivores with a wide, bony skull frill and three horns.
monsters.actions: Charge. Move up to double near attack. If hit, x3 damage.

monsters.name: Brachiosaurus
monsters.description: Colossal, long-necked tree grazers. Slow and peaceful.

monsters.name: Plesiosaurus
monsters.description: Aquatic reptiles as big as elephants. Flat flippers and narrow, toothy maws on long necks.

monsters.name: Velociraptor
monsters.description: Fast, turkey-sized raptors with vicious toe claws. Pack hunters.
monsters.actions: Clever. +1d4 damage when attacking with surprise.

monsters.name: Djinni
monsters.description: Azure-blue, jovial humanoids made of air and roiling wind. Infused with potent magic.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Only damaged by magical sources. Whirlwind. Transform into a lashing tornado. All enemies 2d100 feet in a random direction. Wish. Cast wish once a week for a mortal, no spellcasting check.

monsters.name: Doppelganger
monsters.description: Gray, featureless humanoids that delight in sowing chaos.
monsters.actions: Change Shape. In place of similarly-sized humanoid. Telepathy. Can secretly hear humanoids within near.

monsters.name: Dragons
monsters.description: Dragons are winged, formidable reptiles who carry the ancient magic of the land in their blood. Evil dragons are vain and cunning, while good dragons are noble and sagacious. They can live for many thousands of years. All dragons love treasure and hoard it in their remote, well\u0002protected lairs deep within their favored environ. A dragon's lair has its level x 100 in gold pieces and 1d4 items from the 80-100 range on its treasure table.

monsters.name: Dragon, Desert
monsters.description: The smell of ozone precedes this desert-dwelling dragon. Its dazzling scales of brass and lapis lazuli shimmer in the baking heat.
monsters.actions: Stormblood. Electricity immune. Lightning Breath. A straight line from dragon. DC 15 DEX or 4d8 wearing metal armor). Mirage. 1/day, in place of attacks. disappear when hit. Determine dragon or illusions.

monsters.name: Dragon, Fire
monsters.description: Blood-red scales cover the hide of this mighty, volcanic wyrm. Leaping flames glow at the back of its throat.
monsters.actions: Fireblood. Fire immune. Fire Breath. Fills a double near\u0002sized cube extending from dragon. DC 15 DEX or 6d10 damage.

monsters.name: Dragon, Forest
monsters.description: The smell of wet loam follows this dragon. Its jade scales bristle with barbed thorns.
monsters.actions: Animate Plants. 1/day, in place of attacks. Vines grab at all dragon. DC 15 DEX or unable to move 1d4 rounds. Poison Breath. Fills a near-sized cube extending from dragon. DC 15 CON or 3d8 damage.

monsters.name: Dragon, Frost
monsters.description: Prismatic ice lines the horns, spines, and wings of this pearly dragon. Clouds of steam hiss from its ice-rimed jaws.
monsters.actions: Frostblood. Cold immune. Ice Breath. Fills a double near\u0002sized cube extending from dragon. DC 15 DEX or 4d8 damage and frozen for 1 round.

monsters.name: Dragon, Sea
monsters.description: A warm sea breeze blows around this amphibious, gold\u0002scaled wyrm. A beard of tendrils covers its snout, and a blue mane billows along its neck.
monsters.actions: Steam Breath. Fills a double from dragon. DC 15 DEX or 4d12 damage. Water Spout. Fills a near-sized cube within far. DC 15 STR or in a random direction.
monsters.attackText: 4 rend +10  (2d10) or 1 steam breath or 1  water spout

monsters.name: Dragon, Swamp
monsters.description: This black, wingless beast slithers through dank swamps.
monsters.actions: Smog Breath. Fills a near-sized cube extending from dragon. blinded for 1 round.

monsters.name: Drow
monsters.description: Lithe, subterranean elves with ebon skin, white hair, and red eyes that see in the dark. They are stealthy and cunning. Drow live in strikingly decadent, matriarchal societies centered around the worship of their cruel spider-demon goddess.

monsters.name: Drow
monsters.description: A graceful, shadowy elf that pounces like a spider.
monsters.actions: Poison. DC 15 CON or sleep. Sunblind. Blinded in bright light.

monsters.name: Drow, Priestess
monsters.description: A statuesque female drow with a crown of metal spider webs and an imperious gaze.
monsters.actions: Poison. DC 15 CON or paralyzed 1d4 rounds. Sunblind. Blinded in bright light. Snuff (WIS Spell). DC 12. magical) within near. Summon Spiders (WIS Spell). DC 14. Summon 2d4 loyal giant spiders that appear within near. They stay for 5 rounds. Web (WIS Spell). DC 13. A near\u0002sized cube of webs within far rounds. DC 15 STR on turn to break free.

monsters.name: Drow, Drider
monsters.description: A monstrosity with the body of a giant spider and torso of a drow.
monsters.actions: Poison. DC 15 CON or paralyzed 1d4 rounds. Sunblind. Blinded in bright light.

monsters.name: Druid
monsters.description: A wizard of the wilds holding a knotted staff and wearing a mossy cloak of deep viridian.
monsters.actions: Barkskin (INT Spell). Self. DC 13. AC becomes 15 for 5 rounds. Conjure Flames (INT Spell). DC 12. One target in far takes 2d6 damage. Imbue (INT Spell). Self. DC 13. Staff becomes a +3 magic weapon for 10 rounds. Summon Bear (INT Spell). DC 14. appears within near. It stays for 5 rounds. Thunderclap (INT Spell). DC 13. from druid. Creatures within are direction.

monsters.name: Dryad
monsters.description: A coy, emerald-skinned fey covered in leaves. It bonds with and protects a tree.
monsters.actions: Charm. Near, one creature, DC 14 CHA or friendship for 1d8 days. Meld. Step inside bonded tree.

monsters.name: Duergar
monsters.description: Gray-skinned, greedy dwarves with bald pates and white beards. They dwell in somber castles deep within the earth filled with stolen treasures and enslaved prisoners.
monsters.actions: Enlarge. 1/day, +1d6 damage on checks for 3 rounds. Invisibility. 1/day, turn invisible for 3 rounds. Ends if duergar attacks. Sunblind. Blinded in bright light.

monsters.name: Dung Beetle, Giant
monsters.description: A trundling, barrel-sized beetle with a T-shaped horn.
monsters.actions: Knock. DC 9 STR or pushed a close distance and fall down.

monsters.name: Efreeti
monsters.description: Blood-red, towering humanoids formed of lava and ash. Short, black horns and snarling grins.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Only damaged by magical sources. Fire immune. Wall of Flame. 1/day, 20' high length. Touching it deals 4d8 damage. Lasts 2d4 rounds. Wish. Cast wish once a week for a mortal, no spellcasting check.

monsters.name: Elemental, Air
monsters.description: A howling tornado of wind.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Only damaged by magical sources. Whirlwind. All within close DC random direction.

monsters.name: Elemental, Earth
monsters.description: A thundering pillar of earth.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Only damaged by magical sources. Avalanche. All within close DC 15 under mounds of earth.

monsters.name: Elemental, Fire
monsters.description: A roaring column of flames.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Only damaged by magical sources. Fire immune. Inferno. All within near DC 15 DEX or 3d8 damage.

monsters.name: Elemental, Water
monsters.description: A crashing vortex of water.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Only damaged by magical sources. Whirlpool. All within close DC 15 elemental (treat as underwater). DC 15 STR on turn to escape. rudimentary Primordial. Earth other, as are fire and water. damage. Greater elementals are of damage.

monsters.name: Elephant
monsters.description: Mighty mammals with tough hide, flappy ears, and a trunk.
monsters.actions: Charge. Move up to double near attack. If hit, x3 damage.

monsters.name: Elf
monsters.description: Ethereal, ageless fey-people infused with ancient magic.
monsters.actions: Feyblood. ADV on DEX checks while in the natural wilds.

monsters.name: Ettercap
monsters.description: Bipedal, eight-eyed spiderfolk with spindly legs and purple fur.
monsters.actions: Poison Web. One target stuck in place and 1d4 damage/round. DC 12 DEX on turn to escape.

monsters.name: Fairy
monsters.description: Miniature fey folk with fluttering moth or butterfly wings.
monsters.actions: Poison. DC 12 CON or fall into deep sleep for 1d4 hours.

monsters.name: Frog, Giant
monsters.description: Human-sized frogs with warty skin and long, sticky tongues.
monsters.actions: Tongue. 1 creature in near DC 12 DEX or pulled to close range.

monsters.name: Gargoyle
monsters.description: Leering, winged fiends that look like stone statues. They can hold perfectly still for long stretches of time.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Only damaged by magical sources.

monsters.name: Gelatinous Cube
monsters.description: A translucent cube of slime that silently mows through tunnels.
monsters.actions: Engulf. DC 12 STR or trapped inside cube. Touch attack auto\u0002hits engulfed targets each round. DC 12 STR on turn to escape. Fail checks if paralyzed. Rubbery. Half damage from stabbing weapons. Toxin. DC 15 CON or paralyzed 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Ghast
monsters.description: Greater ghouls who retain the intelligence they had in life.
monsters.actions: Undead. Immune to morale checks. Carrion Stench. Living creatures spellcasting for 5 rounds. Paralyze. DC 12 CON or paralyzed 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Ghoul
monsters.description: Gray-skinned, slavering undead with whipping tongues and flat, reptilian faces.
monsters.actions: Undead. Immune to morale checks. Paralyze. DC 12 CON or paralyzed 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Ghost
monsters.description: A wavering spirit with a face contorted in rage or sadness.
monsters.actions: Greater Undead. Immune to morale checks. Only damaged by silver or magical sources. Incorporeal. In place of attacks, become corporeal or incorporeal. Life Drain. 1d4 CON damage. Death if reduced to 0 CON. Possess. Must be corporeal. One target, close range. Contested CHA check. If ghost wins, it controls it for 2d4 rounds.
monsters.attackText: 2 death touch  +5 (1d8 + life drain) or 1 possess

monsters.name: Giants
monsters.description: Giants once ruled the earth long ago, warring with dragons for supremacy over the seas and skies. But the weariness of eons eventually caused their glorious societies to erode. Now, they live in reclusive clans, wary of outsiders and withdrawn from the younger civilizations. Hill and goat giants are brutish louts who ally with goblinkind. Fire giants build enclaves in volcanoes, frost giants in frozen wastes. Stone giants live deep underground, while cloud giants occupy lofty mountain castles. Mighty storm giants dwell in majestic, deep-sea strongholds.

monsters.name: Giant, Cloud
monsters.description: Pale, angular giants with blue-gray hair, light eyes, and silk robes. They do not allow outsiders into their enclaves.
monsters.actions: Alert. ADV on checks to detect sneaking or hiding creatures.

monsters.name: Giant, Fire
monsters.description: Bulky, muscled giants with coppery skin and red hair. Heavily armored in iron plate mail studded with bronze rivets.
monsters.actions: Fireblood. Fire immune.

monsters.name: Giant, Frost
monsters.description: Blue-skinned warriors with broad shoulders and braided hair. They sound war horns during their frequent raids to pillage nearby settlements.
monsters.actions: Frostblood. Cold immune.

monsters.name: Giant, Stone
monsters.description: Lean, sinewy giants with stony skin and deep-set eyes. They are quiet and poised, often sitting motionless for days at a time.
monsters.actions: Stone Hide. Half damage from stabbing and cutting weapons.

monsters.name: Giant, Goat
monsters.description: Highland-dwelling, barbaric giants with goatlike legs, horns, and horizontal pupils.

monsters.name: Giant, Storm
monsters.description: Regal titans with sea-green skin, flowing white hair, and thundering voices. They breathe water as easily as air.
monsters.actions: Stormblood. Electricity immune. Lightning Bolt. 3/day, 5' wide line extending far from giant. All 5d10 damage. DISADV on check if in water.

monsters.name: Giant, Hill
monsters.description: Fleshy hulks with leathery skin and broad, sloping foreheads. Cruel, boorish, and dim-witted.

monsters.name: Gibbering Mouther
monsters.description: Crawling masses of slime with dozens of screeching, lipless mouths and wet eyeballs.
monsters.actions: Gibbering. Creatures within a random action (d8): 1-3. do nothing, 4-5. move in random direction, 6-7. attack nearest creature, 8. flee. Latch. Attach to bitten target; bites auto-hit next round. DC 12 STR on turn to tear off.

monsters.name: Gladiator
monsters.description: Veteran warriors seasoned in arena fights to the death.

monsters.name: Gnoll
monsters.description: Barbaric, opportunistic hyena\u0002folk who range in large packs.
monsters.actions: Rage. 1/day, immune to morale checks, +1d4 damage (3 rounds).

monsters.name: Gnome, Deep
monsters.description: Gray-skinned, white-haired fey the size of halflings. They hunt for gems and rare cave flora.
monsters.actions: Stone Meld. 2/day, underground only. Turn invisible for 3 rounds.

monsters.name: Goblins
monsters.description: Goblins are the smallest and most numerous of the goblinoids, often serving hobgoblins, bugbears, or even hill giants as replaceable lackeys. They live in filthy, subterranean warrens built of scavenged materials. The goblin boss rules by cruelty and strength, and the shaman wields cryptic sorcery.

monsters.name: Goblin
monsters.description: A short, hairless humanoid with green skin and pointy ears.
monsters.actions: Keen Senses. Can't be surprised.

monsters.name: Goblin, Boss
monsters.description: A scarred goblin with knotted muscles and a crown of iron.
monsters.actions: Keen Senses. Can't be surprised.

monsters.name: Goblin, Shaman
monsters.description: A swaying, chanting goblin wearing necklaces of teeth and a robe of musty rat pelts.
monsters.actions: Keen Senses. Can't be surprised. Bug Brain (WIS Spell). DC 13. Near range, one target. Target's INT drops to 1 for 1d4 rounds. Skitter (WIS Spell). DC 12. Self. Climb like a spider for 5 rounds. Stink Bomb (WIS Spell). DC 12. One target within far 2d4 DISADV on next check/attack.

monsters.name: Golems
monsters.description: Creatures constructed from various materials and imbued with a rudimentary sentience. Making a golem requires rare, expensive materials and a series of complicated rituals.

monsters.name: Golem, Clay
monsters.description: A towering, faceless humanoid shaped from glistening clay.
monsters.actions: Golem. Immune to damage non-magical sources. Healed by acid. Curse. Slam damage can only be healed by level 5+ priest.

monsters.name: Golem, Flesh
monsters.description: A ghastly monstrosity made of sewn-together corpses.
monsters.actions: Golem. Immune to damage sources. Healed by electricity. Berserk. When at or below 20 deal double damage.

monsters.name: Golem, Iron
monsters.description: A bulky iron suit that squeals and sparks with each step.
monsters.actions: Golem. Immune to damage sources. Healed by fire. Poison Breath. All within near, DC 15 CON or 8d6 damage.

monsters.name: Golem, Stone
monsters.description: A wide-limbed, lumbering statue that shakes the ground.
monsters.actions: Golem. Immune to damage non-magical sources. Slow. Far range, one target. DC 15 CON or speed halved 1d4 rds.

monsters.name: Gorgon
monsters.description: A snorting bull made entirely of iron plating. A cloud of green fog billows from its nostrils.
monsters.actions: Charge. Move up to double near attack. If hit, x3 damage. Petrifying Breath. Fills a near\u0002sized cube extending from gorgon. DC 15 CON or petrified (gorgons immune).
monsters.attackText: 2 gore +6 (2d8)  or 1 charge or 1 petrifying breath

monsters.name: Gorilla
monsters.description: Mighty, jungle-dwelling apes.

monsters.name: Gray Ooze
monsters.description: Slick puddles the color of stone.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Immune to damage from acid, cold, or fire. Corrosive. Nonmagical metal on a d6 roll of 1-3.

monsters.name: Grick
monsters.description: A huge worm with four suckered tentacles and a snapping beak.
monsters.actions: Camouflage. Hard to see in cave terrain or rocks. Grab. Target is immobilized. DC break free.

monsters.name: Griffon
monsters.description: Winged hunters with the head of an eagle and body of a lion. Their favored food is horses.

monsters.name: Grimlow
monsters.description: A tall, oval-shaped mammal. A giant, half-moon maw hides on its belly beneath its gray fur.
monsters.actions: Grab. One target in near into its mouth. Bite attacks automatically hit the target. Can only grab 1 target at a time. DC 15 STR on turn to break free.

monsters.name: Guard
monsters.description: A sentry equipped with sturdy weapons and armor.

monsters.name: Hags
monsters.description: Sinister crones who rose out of the black bogs of the Unseelie realms long ago. They are wretched beings of hatred and evil, suffused with cursed magic. Sea hags haunt dank ocean caves and grottoes. Night hags are drawn to places of depravity and woe, while weald hags fester in deep, boggy woods.

monsters.name: Hag, Weald
monsters.description: Eyes dark as moonless nights, skin made of rotting wood, hair of tangled roots and vines.
monsters.actions: Drink Pain. Near range. DC 12 creature; regain that many HP. Shapechange. Instantly change to look like any other humanoid.

monsters.name: Hag, Night
monsters.description: A purple-skinned, stooped woman with stringy, white hair and a mouth full of iron teeth.
monsters.actions: Blind. One target within near DC 15 CHA or blinded for 1d4 days. Shapechange. Instantly change to look like any other humanoid.

monsters.name: Hag, Sea
monsters.description: A green, sunken-faced woman. Seaweed hair and oozing flesh.
monsters.actions: Shapechange. Instantly change to look like any other humanoid. Terrify. A creature who first DISADV on attacks 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Harpy
monsters.description: Horrific, winged women with vulture-like lower bodies. They keen a hypnotic song.
monsters.actions: Song. Enemies who can hear 1d4 rounds. Immune for 1 day if passed check.

monsters.name: Hell Hound
monsters.description: Black wolfhounds with red eyes and jaws dripping with flames.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Fire immune. Fire Breath. Fills a near-sized cube extending from hell hound. DC 15 DEX or 3d8 damage. Cannot use again for 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Hippogriff
monsters.description: Fierce, winged creatures with the lower body of a horse and upper body of a giant eagle.

monsters.name: Hippopotamus
monsters.description: Ornery river-beasts as large as cows with round, purple bodies and bulbous snouts.
monsters.actions: Stumpy. ADV on STR checks to grab or drag other creatures.

monsters.name: Hobgoblin
monsters.description: A sturdy, tall goblin with russet skin. Militant and strategic.
monsters.actions: Phalanx. +1 to attacks and AC hobgoblin.

monsters.name: Horse
monsters.description: Powerful, swift herd animals that roam open plains.

monsters.name: Hydra
monsters.description: A towering, amphibious reptile with a bouquet of snake heads writhing on long necks.
monsters.actions: Heads. Choose how many heads the hydra has. Each is LV 2, AC attack. A killed head sprouts into beforehand. The hydra's LV is all the heads combined.

monsters.name: Invisible Stalker
monsters.description: Intelligent creatures made of flowing air. Often bound to the bidding of evil sorcerers for their peerless tracking ability.
monsters.actions: Bound. A secret, mundane stalker's magical servitude. Invisible. Naturally invisible. Tracking. Can always sense the direction of its chosen quarry.

monsters.name: Jellyfish
monsters.description: Hand-sized, purple sea jellies with stinging tentacles.
monsters.actions: Toxin. DC 9 CON or paralyzed 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Knight
monsters.description: A warrior in shining plate mail and the surcoat of a knightly order.
monsters.actions: Oath. 3/day, ADV on a roll made in service of knight's order.

monsters.name: Kobold
monsters.description: Puny, scaled coyote-lizards that dwell underground.
monsters.actions: Dodge. 1/day, an attack that would hit misses instead.

monsters.name: Kobold, Sorcerer
monsters.description: A scaly dog-lizard painted with colorful stripes and rattling a hefty leg bone strung with beads and feathers.
monsters.actions: Dodge. 1/day, an attack that would hit misses instead. Scorpion Sting (CHA Spell). DC 11. Near range, one target. 1d6 on next attack roll or check. Spider Swarm (CHA Spell). DC 12. A spider swarm appears within near. Stays 1d4 rounds. Follows sorcerer's commands.

monsters.name: Kraken
monsters.description: Primordial, tentacled leviathans the size of war galleons. They live in the lightless depths of the deep ocean.

monsters.name: W
monsters.description: +3, Ch +4, AL C, LV 17 Impervious. Electricity immune. Crush. Tentacle attacks deal double damage against objects. Lightning Bolt. Straight line (5' wide) extending far from kraken. DC 15 DEX or 6d6 damage. Storm. Seas become violently turbulent in 1 mile radius around kraken. Lasts 2d4 rounds. Seaborne vessels have a 1:6 chance of capsizing each round.

monsters.name: Leech, Giant
monsters.description: A glossy black, blood-drinking slug as large as a cat.

monsters.name: D
monsters.description: -1, C +1, I -3, W -1, Ch -3, AL N, LV 2 Attach. Attach to target; bite auto-hits next round. DC 12 STR on turn to tear off. 230

monsters.name: Leprechaun
monsters.description: Impish fey who favor green garb and love fooling \
with promises of gold.
monsters.actions: Alert. Cannot be surprised. Slippery. Hostile spells targeting the leprechaun are DC 15 to cast. Fool's Gold (CHA Spell). DC 12. Close. One small object or small group of similar objects. Turn objects into silver or gold pieces. Lasts 1 day. Illusion (CHA Spell). DC 11. or auditory illusion within near. Lasts until dismissed. Invisibility (CHA Spell). DC 12. Self. Become invisible for 2d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Lich
monsters.description: A wizard who has completed a necromantic ritual to become a mighty, undead sorcerer. Its withered body is draped in moldering, silk robes, and red marshlights burn in its eyes.
monsters.actions: Supreme Undead. Immune to morale checks. Only damaged by magical sources. Phylactery. Can't be killed while spirit vessel (an object) is intact. Paralysis. DC 15 CON or paralyzed 1d4 rounds. Flight (INT Spell). Self. DC 13. Fly double near for 5 rounds. Null (INT Spell). Self. DC 14. DC 18 to cast. Lasts 1d4 rounds. Shadow Leap (INT Spell). Self. DC 14. Teleport up to 100 miles. Sigil of Doom (INT Spell). DC 15. near DC 15 CON or go to 0 HP. Wither (INT Spell). DC 14. 4d8 near-sized cube centered on lich.

monsters.name: Lion
monsters.description: Tawny great cats that hunt in open plains. Males have manes.

monsters.name: Lizardfolk
monsters.description: Crocodilian humanoids with scaly faces, claws, and tails. They dwell in swamps and rivers.

monsters.name: Mage
monsters.description: Trained wizards who are often members of a sorcerous order.
monsters.actions: Arcane Armor (INT Spell). Self. DC 12. AC 16 for 2d4 rounds. Blast (INT Spell). DC 12. Far, one target. 2d6 damage. Cancel (INT Spell). DC 13. End within near. Levitate (INT Spell). DC 12. Close. Focus. Hover near for duration, vertical movement only. Snare (INT Spell). DC 13. Focus. near paralyzed for duration.

monsters.name: Mammoth
monsters.description: Massive, shaggy elephants with tusks that reach the ground.
monsters.actions: Thick Fur. Cold immune. Charge. Move up to double near attack. If hit, x3 damage.

monsters.name: Manta Ray, Giant
monsters.description: Swooping manta rays as large as longboats. Gentle and intelligent enough to be trained.
monsters.actions: Poison. DC 15 CON or drop to 0 hit points in 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Manticore
monsters.description: Human-faced lions with bat wings and cruelly spiked tails. They speak halting Thanian and love devouring human flesh.
monsters.actions: Spikes. Manticores have 4d6 tail spikes. They regrow each day.

monsters.name: Mastiff
monsters.description: Muscled guard dogs with fierce loyalty to their pack or owners.

monsters.name: Medusa
monsters.description: Immortal women with coiling snakes for hair and scaled skin.
monsters.actions: Godborn. Hostile spells targeting the medusa are DC 15 to cast. Petrify. Any creature (including medusa, DC 15 CON or petrified. Poison. DC 15 CON or go to 0 HP.

monsters.name: Merfolk
monsters.description: Ocean dwellers with human upper bodies and long fish tails.

monsters.name: Mimic
monsters.description: Beasts that look like objects.
monsters.actions: Stick. DC 15 STR or adhere to target; auto-hit with bite. DC 15 STR on turn to remove.

monsters.name: Minotaur
monsters.description: Ferocious bull-men with hooves and curved horns. They live in mazelike tunnels.
monsters.actions: Charge. In place of attacks, attack. If hit, x2 damage.

monsters.name: Moose
monsters.description: A towering, brown-haired grazer with weighty, flat antlers.
monsters.actions: gems. Once the head of the ancient, wizardly order of Gehemna, reigning archmage. He has served as an advisor and historian speaking of two topics: his origins, and The Ten-Eyed Oracle. Legendary Undead. Immune to morale checks. Only damaged by magical sources. Hostile spells targeting Mordanticus are DC 18 to cast. Crown of Gehemna. 3/day, cause a spell being cast within far to fail. Necrosis. DC 15 CON or go to 0 HP. Healing spells are DC 15 to cast on target while at 0 HP due to this effect. Phylactery. Cannot be killed while spirit vessel (a diamond) is intact. Absorb (INT Spell). DC 13. Near, one target. Target loses the ability regains a lost spell of the same tier or less. Banish (INT Spell). DC 14. All extradimensional creatures within near DC 15 CHA or sent back to their home planes. Bind (INT Spell). DC 12. One humanoid in far paralyzed 1d4 rounds. Blast (INT Spell). DC 14. One creature in near takes 5d8 damage. Phase (INT Spell). DC 13. Self. Teleport up to one mile. True Name (INT Spell). DC 15. Near. Learn the True Name of target.

monsters.name: Mordanticus The Flayed
monsters.description: âLong have I held the weighty secrets of Gehemna, an age-old litany inscribed upon my weary soul.\
-Obe-Ixx of Azarumme 239

monsters.name: Ochre Jelly
monsters.description: An orange puddle of quivering slime.
monsters.actions: Split. If cut or chopped, split remaining HP between both). Can split up to four times.

monsters.name: Octopus, Giant
monsters.description: Octopi as large as sailing skiffs.
monsters.actions: Grab. DC 15 STR or immobilized. Tentacle auto-hits each round. DC 15 STR on turn to break free. Ink. In place of attacks, ink cloud blinds all in near for 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Ogre
monsters.description: A massive, dim-witted brute with tusks and a heavy frame. Often lords over goblins or orcs.

monsters.name: Oni
monsters.description: Cunning and sorcerous ogre\u0002demons with shaggy white hair, blue skin, and yellow eyes.
monsters.actions: Shapeshift. In place of attacks, into original form. Fade (CHA Spell). DC 13. Self. Become invisible for 1d4 rounds. Hellfrost (CHA Spell). DC 13. extending from oni 3d6 damage. Mist (CHA Spell). DC 13. Self. double near. Lasts 2d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Orc
monsters.description: A tusked, tall humanoid with gray skin and pointed ears.
monsters.actions: Rage. 1/day, immune to morale checks, +1d4 damage (3 rounds).

monsters.name: Orc, Chieftain
monsters.description: An imposing orc with scars crisscrossing its body.
monsters.actions: Rage. 1/day, immune to morale checks, +1d4 damage (3 rounds).

monsters.name: Otyugh
monsters.description: Stumpy, three-legged beasts with barbed tentacles and vast mouths. Drawn by rot and filth.
monsters.actions: Disease. DC 15 CON or infected. HP (can't heal). Ends on success.

monsters.name: Outsiders
monsters.description: Alien horrors from the frozen, outer reaches of the cosmos or the Chaos-infused Dark Realms. Outsiders were born from the nightmares of gods and are unsettling to all other creatures.

monsters.name: Primordial Slime
monsters.description: A mass of clear ooze strobing with sick pulses of violet light.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Only harmed by fire. Dissolve. One random piece of carries is destroyed.

monsters.name: Void Spawn
monsters.description: Scythe-like limbs jut from a purple bulb as big as an ogre. Its lower half is a nest of tentacles.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Immune to cold. Toxin. DC 12 CON or paralyzed for 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Void Spider
monsters.description: Pale, horse-sized arachnids that become ghostly and intangible.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Immune to cold. Phase. Once per round, become corporeal or incorporeal. Poison. DC 12 CON or drop to 0 HP in 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Rime Walker
monsters.description: Human-shaped beings formed from black space ice. Their eyes are two flickering, white lights.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Immune to cold. Ice Aura. Enemies within near of of turn or lose action.

monsters.name: Owlbear
monsters.description: Cantankerous bears with owl eyes, beaks, and feathers.
monsters.actions: Crush. Deals an extra die of with both claws.

monsters.name: Panther
monsters.description: Supple large cats with blue\u0002black fur. Stealthy hunters.

monsters.name: Peasant
monsters.description: A commoner in worn clothes.

monsters.name: Pegasus
monsters.description: Winged horses with noble bearings and pearly white coats.

monsters.name: Phoenix
monsters.description: Huge, soaring eagles made of searing flames. Intelligent and imbued with immortal magic.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Immune to fire. sources. Explosion. Upon death, damage. Heat Aura. Creatures within near CON or 2d6 damage. Rebirth. A red-hot egg remains after death. Phoenix hatches from it in 1d4 days.

monsters.name: Piranha, Swarm
monsters.description: A school of flat, silvery fish with vicious fangs.
monsters.actions: Savage. ADV on attacks against creatures below half their HP.

monsters.name: Pirate
monsters.description: Seafaring scoundrels who live to steal and hoard treasure.

monsters.name: Priest
monsters.description: A respected member of a clergy who leads holy rituals and rites.
monsters.actions: Anoint (WIS Spell). DC 12. Close. a magic +2 version for 10 rounds. Healing Touch (WIS Spell). DC 11. Heal one creature within close for 2d4 HP. Holy Flame (WIS Spell). DC 13. Self. Weapons ignite in magic 1d6 damage for 5 rounds. Rebuke (WIS Spell). DC 13. Focus. Chaotic creatures cannot near range for duration.

monsters.name: Purple Worm
monsters.description: A massive worm as tall as a castle keep. Has a rotating maw and is covered in purple chitin.
monsters.actions: Poison. DC 15 CON or go to 0 HP. Swallow. On a natural attack roll of 18-20, target is swallowed. damage per round. Worm round to the inside of its gullet.

monsters.name: Rakshasa
monsters.description: Demonic illusionists whose true form is of a humanlike great cat with backwards hands.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Only damaged by magical sources. Immune to hostile spells of 3rd tier or lower. Mesmerism. Can read the minds of all creatures within near. Can appearance of any humanoid. Weakness. A crossbow bolt weapon spell kills the rakshasa.

monsters.name: Rat
monsters.description: Rangy, plague-carrying rodents that infest underground places.
monsters.actions: Disease. DC 9 CON or 1d4 CON damage (can't heal while ill). on success. Die at 0 CON.

monsters.name: Rat, Giant
monsters.description: Cunning rats as large as cats. Mangy fur and wormlike tails.
monsters.actions: Disease. DC 12 CON or 1d4 CON damage (can't heal while ill). on success. Die at 0 CON.

monsters.name: Rat, Dire
monsters.description: Child-sized, savage rats bristling with bony face and spine ridges.
monsters.actions: Disease. DC 12 CON or 1d4 CON damage (can't heal while ill). on success. Die at 0 CON.

monsters.name: Rat, Swarm
monsters.description: A screeching tidal wave of clawing and biting rats.
monsters.actions: Disease. DC 9 CON or 1d4 CON damage (can't heal while ill). on success. Die at 0 CON. tall. Rathgamnon is Madeera the Covenant's mightiest servant; his blank eyes see far into the depths of time and space. He spends all of power in the cosmos, or threats to the laws of reality itself. Legendary. Only damaged by magical sources. Hostile spells targeting Rathgamnon are DC 18 to cast. Roar. In place of attacks, all creatures who can hear within far DC 18 CHA or be rendered blind and speechless for 1d4 days. Abjure (WIS Spell). DC 13. Self. End any hostile magical effects affecting Rathgamnon. Abolish (WIS Spell). DC 13. One target in far takes 5d8 damage. Anchor (WIS Spell). DC 14. One target in far DC 18 STR or bound and anchored by chains of golden runes for 1d4 rounds. Gate (WIS Spell). DC 14. Open a portal at a point within near to another location on any plane. Lasts 1d6 rounds or until dismissed. Portent (WIS Spell). DC 14. Lasts 2d4 rounds. One target in near has advantage or disadvantage on all attack rolls and checks. Time Stop (WIS Spell). DC 15. Self. Time freezes for everyone except Rathgamnon for 1d4 rounds. Everything that occurs during the time freeze happens simultaneously when the spell ends.

monsters.name: Rathgamnon
monsters.description: âThe stars told me of your arrival here many eons ago, long before the first of your people walked the earth.\

-The Ten-Eyed Oracle 256 A colossal, four-legged reptile with crocodilian jaws, amber scales, and a diamond-hard, spiked carapace. It towers overhead like a mountain, able to swallow entire villages in one gulp. The tarrasque hibernates deep in the earth or at the bottom of the sea for centuries, only awakening long enough to fill its vast belly in an indiscriminate rampage of terror and destruction. There is only one tarrasque, and it is the most dreaded creature to walk the earth.
monsters.actions: Legendary. Only damaged by magical sources. Hostile spells targeting the tarrasque are DC 18 to cast. Deep Dweller. Immune to harm from fire and cold. Amphibious. Permanent Death. Cannot be permanently killed unless a wish spell is cast on it while it is at 0 HP. Rampage. In place of attacks, move far in a straight line and make one bite attack. On a hit, triple damage. Reflective Carapace. Immune to rays, blasts, or bolts of energy. 1:6 chance these are reflected back at their originator. Regeneration. Regains 4d10 lost HP at the beginning of its turn. Sever. On a natural attack roll of 18+, the attack also severs a random limb. 1d6: 1. Head, 2-4. Arm, 5-6. Leg. Swallow. DC 18 STR or swallowed whole. Total darkness inside and 4d10 damage per round. Tarrasque regurgitates all swallowed if dealt at least 30 damage in one round to the inside of its gullet.
monsters.attackText: 4 thrash (near) +13 (3d10 + sever) and 1 bite (near)  +13 (5d10 + sever + swallow)

monsters.name: Thief
monsters.description: A cat burglar in a black cloak.
monsters.actions: Stealthy. ADV on DEX checks to sneak and hide. Backstab. Deal x2 damage against surprised creatures.

monsters.name: Thug
monsters.description: A bruised and boorish ruffian.

monsters.name: Treant
monsters.description: Peaceful, slow-moving trees with merry eyes and tremulous voices. They protect the forest.
monsters.actions: Animate Tree. 2/day. In place this ability. Reverts back in 1 day.

monsters.name: Troll
monsters.description: Green, lanky giants with warty skin and territorial rage. Lair in deep forests and swamps.
monsters.actions: Regenerate. Regains 2d6 HP on cauterized with fire or acid.

monsters.name: Troll, Frost
monsters.description: Rime-covered trolls with blue skin and flinty, black eyes. They stalk arctic lands and frozen boreal forests.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Cold and fire immune. Regenerate. Regains 2d6 HP on cauterized with acid.

monsters.name: Unicorn
monsters.description: A silvery horse with a flowing mane and a single spiral horn.
monsters.actions: Healing Horn. A touch heals 2d6 HP or ends one curse or disease.

monsters.name: Vampire
monsters.description: Pale, blood-drinking undead of supreme power and wickedness. They loathe sunlight and protect their coffins at all costs.
monsters.actions: Supreme Undead. Immune to morale checks. Only damaged by magical sources. Blood Drain. Vampire heals 2d6 1d4 CON. At 0 CON, target dies spawn (vampire chooses). Charm. One humanoid target vampire's control for 1d4 days. Shapechange. In place of back into regular form. Vampire. Must sleep in a coffin in coffin. Takes 3d8 damage sunlight. Cannot be killed unless wooden stake while at 0 HP.

monsters.name: Vampire Spawn
monsters.description: Lesser, feral vampires born from the bite of their vampiric sires. Bloodthirsty and savage. They rarely leave a victim alive.
monsters.actions: Greater Undead. Immune to morale checks. Only damaged by silver or magical sources. Blood Drain. Vampire heals 2d6 1d4 CON. At 0 CON, target dies and rises as a vampire spawn. Vampire. Must sleep in a coffin in coffin. Takes 3d8 damage sunlight. Cannot be killed unless wooden stake while at 0 HP.

monsters.name: Violet Fungus
monsters.description: Child-sized, creeping fungi with neon purple caps. Their whiplike roots decompose living flesh.

monsters.name: Viperians
monsters.description: A fallen and scattered civilization of snake-people who built their blood-soaked dynasties with sorcery and cunning. Their descendants fight for scraps of faded grandeur in the decaying ruins of their forgotten cities. Small circles of viperian wizards practice ancient magic and lead their enclaves. Viperian ophids are rare and much more snakelike than their brethren, serving as esteemed guardians and warriors.

monsters.name: Viperian
monsters.description: Lithe, snake-headed people with cobra hoods and emerald green scales covering their bodies.

monsters.name: Viperian, Ophid
monsters.description: A giant anaconda body merges into a humanoid torso with a large snake head. It wears golden torcs and strings of glittering moonstones.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Can only be harmed by magical sources.

monsters.name: Viperian, Wizard
monsters.description: Thin viperians with scales tinged in black. They wear silk robes and silver, serpentine jewelry.
monsters.actions: Hiss (INT Spell). DC 12. End one spell within far. Summon Cobra (INT Spell). DC 13. Summon 1d4 loyal cobras that appear within near. They leave in 1d4 rounds. Venom (INT Spell). DC 12. One target in far takes 2d8 damage. Whispers (INT Spell). DC 14. Focus. All enemies within near duration.

monsters.name: Vulture
monsters.description: Scavenger birds with black feathers, hunched backs, and bald heads.
monsters.actions: Carrion Tracker. Can track dead flesh unerringly within a mile.

monsters.name: Wasp, Giant
monsters.description: Man-sized wasps with glossy, yellow-striped abdomens.
monsters.actions: Venom. DC 9 CON or go to 0 HP.

monsters.name: Werewolf
monsters.description: A bipedal, wolf-faced humanoid covered in brown fur.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Only damaged by silver or magic sources. Lycanthropy. If 12 or more werewolf, contract lycanthropy.

monsters.name: Wererat
monsters.description: A slinking, rat-faced humanoid covered in mangy fur.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Only damaged by silver or magic sources. Lycanthropy. If 12 or more contract lycanthropy.

monsters.name: Wight
monsters.description: A pale, armored undead warrior with sinister intelligence.
monsters.actions: Greater Undead. Immune to morale checks. Only damaged by silver or magical sources. Life Drain. 1d4 CON damage. Death if reduced to 0 CON.

monsters.name: Will-o'-wisp
monsters.description: A bobbing marsh light animated by an evil spirit. It tries to lead the living into danger.
monsters.actions: Life Drain. 1d4 CON damage. Death if reduced to 0 CON.

monsters.name: Wolf
monsters.description: A giant canine with a gray pelt, yellow eyes, and dripping jaws.
monsters.actions: Pack Hunter. Deals +1 damage while an ally is close.

monsters.name: Wolf, Dire
monsters.description: A massive wolf with spines of black bone along its brow ridge and back.
monsters.actions: Pack Hunter. Deals +1 damage while an ally is close.

monsters.name: Wolf, Winter
monsters.description: Sinister, white-pelted wolves with piercing blue eyes. From the fey realms of eternal winter.
monsters.actions: Impervious. Cold immune. Frost Breath. Fills a near-sized wolf. DC 15 DEX or 3d8 damage. Cannot use again for 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Worg
monsters.description: Bat-faced wolves that speak Goblin and often serve as war mounts for goblinkind.

monsters.name: Wraith
monsters.description: A shadowy spirit seething with anger and malice. Its presence is unsettling to animals.
monsters.actions: Greater Undead. Immune to morale checks. Only damaged by silver or magical sources. Incorporeal. In place of attacks, become corporeal or incorporeal. Life Drain. 1d4 CON damage. Death if reduced to 0 CON.

monsters.name: Wyvern
monsters.description: Dragon-cousins with a large tail stinger, mottled lizard skin, and leathery wings.
monsters.actions: Poison. DC 15 CON or take 2d10 damage.

monsters.name: Zombie
monsters.description: Lurching and decomposed undead that hunt in mobs.
monsters.actions: Undead. Immune to morale checks. Relentless. If zombie reduced to 0 CON.

spells.name: Acid Arrow
spells.description: You conjure a corrosive bolt that hits one foe, dealing 1d6 damage a round. The bolt remains in the target for as long as you focus.

spells.name: Alarm
spells.description: You touch one object, such as a door threshold, setting a magical alarm on it. If any creature you do not designate while casting the spell touches or crosses past the object, a magical bell sounds in your head.

spells.name: Alter Self
spells.description:
You magically change your physical form, gaining one feature that modifies your existing anatomy.

For example, you can grow functional gills on your neck or bear claws on your fingers. This spell can't grow wings or limbs.

spells.name: Animate Dead
spells.description: You touch one humanoid's remains, and it rises as a zombie or skeleton under your control. The remains must have at least three limbs and its head intact.The undead creature acts on your turn. After 1 day, the creature collapses into grave dust.

spells.name: Antimagic Shell
spells.description:
An invisible, near-sized cube of null-magic appears centered on you.

Within the cube, no spells can be cast. Magic items and spells have no effect in the zone, and no magic can enter.

The cube moves with you. Spells such as dispel magic have no effect on it.

Another antimagic shell does not affect this one.

spells.name: Arcane Eye
spells.description:
You conjure an invisible, grape- sized eye within range.

You can see through the eye. It can see in the dark out to near range, fly near on your turn, and squeeze through openings as narrow as a keyhole.

spells.name: Augury
spells.description:
You interpret the meaning of supernatural portents and omens.

Ask the GM one question about a specific course of action. The GM says whether the action will lead to âwealâ or âwoe.â

spells.name: Bless
spells.description: One creature you touch gains a luck token.

spells.name: Blind/deafen
spells.description: You utter a divine censure, blinding or deafening one creature you can see in range.The creature has disadvantage on tasks requiring the lost sense.

spells.name: Burning Hands
spells.description:
You spread your fingers with thumbs touching, unleashing a circle of flame that roars out to a close area around where you stand.

Creatures within the area of effect take 1d6 damage, and flammable objects catch fire.

spells.name: Charm Person
spells.description:
You magically beguile one humanoid of level 2 or less within near range, who regards you as a friend for the duration.

The spell ends if you or your allies do anything to hurt it that it notices.

The target knows you magically enchanted it after the spell ends.

spells.name: Cleansing Weapon
spells.description: One weapon you touch is wreathed in purifying flames. It deals an additional 1d4 damage (1d6 vs. undead) for the duration.

spells.name: Cloudkill
spells.description:
A putrid cloud of yellow poison fills a near-sized cube within range. It spreads around corners.

Creatures inside the cloud are blinded and take 2d6 damage at the beginning of their turns.A creature of LV 9 or less that ends its turn fully inside the cloud dies.

spells.name: Command
spells.description:
You issue a verbal command to one creature in range who can understand you. The command must be one word, such as âkneel.â The target obeys the command for as long as you focus.

If your command is ever directly harmful to the creature, it may make a CHA check vs. your last spellcasting check. On a success, the spell ends.

spells.name: Commune
spells.description:
You seek your god's counsel. Ask the GM up to three yes or no questions. The GM truthfully answers "yes" or "no" to each.

If you cast this spell more than once in 24 hours, treat a failed spellcasting check for it as a critical failure instead.

spells.name: Confusion
spells.description: You mesmerize one creature you can see in range. The target can't take actions, and it moves in a random direction on its turn. If the target is LV 9+, it may make a WIS check vs. your last spellcasting check at the start of its turn to end the spell.

spells.name: Control Water
spells.description: You move and shape water. You can cause a section of water up to 100 feet in width and depth to change shape, defy gravity, or flow in a different direction.

spells.name: Create Undead
spells.description:
You conjure a vengeful undead creature to do your bidding.

When you cast this spell, you choose to summon either a wight or wraith. It appears next to you and is under your control.

The undead creature acts on your turn. After 1 day, it melts away into smoke.

spells.name: Cure Wounds
spells.description:
Your touch restores ebbing life.

Roll a number of d6s equal to 1 + half your level (rounded down). One target you touch regains that many hit points.

spells.name: Detect Magic
spells.description: You can sense the presence of magic within near range for the spell's duration. If you focus for two rounds, you discern its general properties. Full barriers block this spell.

spells.name: Dimension Door
spells.description: You teleport yourself and up to one other willing creature within close to any point you can see.

spells.name: Disintegrate
spells.description:
A green ray shoots from your finger and turns a creature or object into ash.

A target creature of LV 5 or less instantly dies. If it is LV 6+, it takes 3d8 damage instead.

A non-magical object up to the size of a large tree is destroyed.

spells.name: Dispel Magic
spells.description: End one spell that affects one target you can see in range.

spells.name: Divination
spells.description:
You throw the divining bones or peer into the blackness between the stars, seeking a portent.

You can ask the GM one yes or no question. The GM truthfully answers "yes" or "no." 

If you cast this spell more than once in 24 hours, treat a failed spellcasting check for it as a critical failure instead.

spells.name: Divine Vengeance
spells.description: You become the divine avatar of your god's wrath, wreathed in holy flames or a black aura of smoldering corruption.For the spell's duration, you can fly a near distance, your weapons are magical, and you have a +4 bonus to your weapon attacks and damage.

spells.name: Dominion
spells.description:
Mighty beings come to your aid.

The beings must have a combined total of 16 levels or less. Chaotic PCs summon demons/devils, and lawful or neutral PCs summon angels.

The beings act of free will to aid you on your turn. After 10 rounds, they return to their realms.

You cannot cast this spell again until you complete penance.

spells.name: Fabricate
spells.description: This spell can't target creatures.You turn a tree-sized collection of raw materials into a finished work. For example, you convert a pile of bricks or rocks into a bridge. The finished work converts back to raw materials when the spell ends.

spells.name: Feather Fall
spells.description:
You may make an attempt to cast this spell when you fall.

Your rate of descent slows so that you land safely on your feet.

spells.name: Fireball
spells.description: You hurl a small flame that erupts into a fiery blast. All creatures in a near-sized cube around where the flame lands take 4d6 damage.

spells.name: Fixed Object
spells.description: An object you touch that weighs no more than 5 pounds becomes fixed in its current location. It can support up to 5,000 pounds of weight for the duration of the spell.

spells.name: Flame Strike
spells.description: You call down a holy pillar of fire, immolating one creature you can see within range. The target takes 2d6 damage.

spells.name: Floating Disk
spells.description: You create a floating, circular disk of force with a concave center. It can carry up to 20 gear slots. It hovers at waist level and automatically stays within near of you. It can't cross over drop- offs or pits taller than a human.

spells.name: Gaseous Form
spells.description:
You and your gear turn into a cloud of smoke for the spell's duration.

You can fly and pass through any gap that smoke could. You can sense the terrain and any movement around you out to a near distance.

You can't cast spells while in this form.

spells.name: Fly
spells.description: Your feet lift from the ground, and you take to the air like a hummingbird. You can fly near for the spell's duration and are able to hover in place.

spells.name: Heal
spells.description: One creature you touch is healed to full hit points.You cannot cast this spell again until you complete a rest.

spells.name: Hold Monster
spells.description: You paralyze one creature you can see within range.If the target is LV 9+, it may make a STR check vs. your last spellcasting check at the start of its turn to end the spell.

spells.name: Holy Weapon
spells.description: One weapon you touch is imbued with a sacred blessing. The weapon becomes magical and has +1 to attack and damage rolls for the duration.

spells.name: Hold Person
spells.description: You magically paralyze one humanoid creature of LV 4 or less you can see within range.

spells.name: Hold Portal
spells.description: You magically hold a portal closed for the duration. A creature must make a successful STR check vs. your spellcasting check to open the portal. The knock spell ends this spell.

spells.name: Illusion
spells.description:
You create a convincing visible and audible illusion that fills up to a near-sized cube in range.

The illusion cannot cause harm, but creatures who believe the illusion is real react to it as though it were.

A creature who inspects the illusion from afar must pass a WIS check vs. your last spellcasting check to perceive the false nature of the illusion.Touching the illusion also reveals its false nature.

spells.name: Invisibility
spells.description: A creature you touch becomes invisible for the spell's duration.The spell ends if the target attacks or casts a spell.

spells.name: Judgement
spells.description:
You instantly banish a creature you touch, sending it and all possessions it carries to face the judgment of your god.

You can banish an intelligent creature of LV 10 or less.

When the creature returns in 5 rounds, it has been healed to full hit points if its deeds pleased your god. It has been reduced to 1 hit point if its deeds angered your god. If your god can't judge its actions, it is unchanged.

spells.name: Knock
spells.description: A door, window, gate, chest, or portal you can see within range instantly opens, defeating all mundane locks and barriers.This spell creates a loud knock audible to all within earshot.

spells.name: Lay To Rest
spells.description:
You instantly send an undead creature you touch to its final afterlife, destroying it utterly.

You can target an undead creature of LV 9 or less.

spells.name: Levitate
spells.description: You can float a near distance vertically per round on your turn. You can also push against solid objects to move horizontally.

spells.name: Light
spells.description: One object you touch glows with bright, heatless light, illuminating out to a near distance for 1 hour of real time.

spells.name: Lightning Bolt
spells.description:
You shoot a blue-white ray of lightning from your hands, hitting all creatures in a straight line out to a far distance.

Creatures struck by the lightning take 3d6 damage.

spells.name: Mage Armor
spells.description: An invisible layer of magical force protects your vitals. Your armor class becomes 14 (18 on a critical spellcasting check) for the spell's duration.

spells.name: Magic Circle
spells.description:
You conjure a circle of runes out to near-sized cube centered on yourself and name a type of creature (for example, demons).

For the spell's duration, creatures of the chosen type cannot attack or cast a hostile spell on anyone inside the circle. The chosen creatures also can't possess, compel, or beguile anyone inside the circle.

spells.name: Magic Missile
spells.description:
You have advantage on your check to cast this spell.

A glowing bolt of force streaks from your open hand, dealing 1d4 damage to one target.

spells.name: Mass Cure
spells.description: All allies within near range of you regain 2d6 hit points.

spells.name: Mirror Image
spells.description:
You create a number of illusory duplicates of yourself equal to half your level rounded down (minimum 1). The duplicates surround you and mimic you.

Each time a creature attacks you, the attack misses and causes one of the duplicates to evaporate. If all of the illusions have disappeared, the spell ends.

spells.name: Misty Step
spells.description: In a puff of smoke, you teleport a near distance to an area you can see.

spells.name: Passwall
spells.description:
A tunnel of your height opens in a barrier you touch and lasts for the duration.

The passage can be up to near distance in length and must be in a straight line.

spells.name: Pillar Of Salt
spells.description:
A creature you target turns into a statue made of hardened salt.

You can target a creature you can see of LV 5 or less.If you successfully focus on this spell for 3 rounds in a row, the transformation becomes permanent.

spells.name: Plane Shift
spells.description: You fold space and time, transporting yourself and all willing creatures within close range to a location on another plane of your choice.Unless you have been to your intended location before, you appear in a random place on the destination plane.

spells.name: Polymorph
spells.description:
You transform a creature you touch into another natural creature you choose of equal or smaller size. Any gear the target carries melds into its new form.

The target gains the creature's physical stats and features, but it retains its non-physical stats and features.

If the target goes to 0 hit points, it reverts to its true form at half its prior hit points.

You can target any willing creature with this spell, or an unwilling creature whose level is less than or equal to half your level rounded down (min. 1).

spells.name: Power Word Kill
spells.description:
You utter the Word of Doom. One creature you target of LV 9 or less dies if it hears you.

Treat a failed spellcasting check for this spell as a critical failure, and roll the mishap with disadvantage.

spells.name: Prismatic Orb
spells.description:
You send a strobing orb of energy streaking toward a target within range.

Choose an energy type from fire, cold, or electricity. The orb deals 3d8 damage and delivers a concussive blast of the chosen energy type.If the energy type is anathema to the target's existence (for example, cold energy against a fire elemental), the orb deals double damage to it instead.

spells.name: Prophecy
spells.description:
You commune directly with your god for guidance.Ask the GM one question.The GM answers the question truthfully using the knowledge your god possesses. Deities are mighty, but not omniscient.

You cannot cast this spell again until you complete penance.

spells.name: Protection From Energy
spells.description: One creature you touch becomes impervious to the wild fury of the elements.Choose fire, cold, or electricity. For the spell's duration, the target is immune to harm from energy of the chosen type.

spells.name: Protection From Evil
spells.description:
For the spell's duration, chaotic beings have disadvantage on attack rolls and hostile spellcasting checks against the target. These beings also can't possess, compel, or beguile it.

When cast on an already-possessed target, the possessing entity makes a CHA check vs. the last spellcasting check. On a failure, the entity is expelled.

spells.name: Rebuke Unholy
spells.description:
You rebuke creatures who oppose your alignment, forcing them to flee. You must present a holy symbol to cast this spell.

If you are lawful or neutral, this spell affects demons, devils, and outsiders. If you are chaotic, this spell affects angels and natural creatures of the wild.Affected creatures within near of you must make a CHA check vs. your spellcasting check. If a creature fails by 10+ points and is equal to or less than your level, it is destroyed. Otherwise, on a fail, it flees from you for 5 rounds.

spells.name: Resilient Sphere
spells.description:
You conjure a weightless, glassy sphere around you that extends out to close range.

For the spell's duration, nothing can pass through or crush the sphere.

You can roll the sphere a near distance on your turn.

spells.name: Regenerate
spells.description: A creature you touch regains 1d4 hit points on your turn for the duration. This spell also regrows lost body parts.

spells.name: Restoration
spells.description: With the touch of your hands, you expunge curses and illnesses. One curse, illness, or affliction of your choice affecting the target creature ends.

spells.name: Scrying
spells.description:
You look into a crystal ball or reflecting pool, calling up images of a distant place.

For the spell's duration, you can see and hear a creature or location you choose that is on the same plane.

This spell is DC 18 to cast if you try to scry on a creature or location that is unfamiliar to you.

Each round, creatures you view may make a WIS check vs. your last spellcasting check. On a success, they become aware of your magical observation.

spells.name: Shapechange
spells.description:
You transform yourself and any gear you carry into another natural creature you've seen of level 10 or less. You assume the creature's physical stats and features, but you retain your non-physical stats and features (including INT, WIS, and CHA).

If you go to 0 HP while under the effects of this spell, you revert to your true form at 1 HP.

spells.name: Sending
spells.description: You send a brief, mental message to any creature with whom you are familiar who is on the same plane.

spells.name: Shield Of Faith
spells.description: A protective force wrought of your holy conviction surrounds you. You gain a +2 bonus to your armor class for the duration.

spells.name: Silence
spells.description: You magically mute sound in a near cube within the spell's range. Creatures inside the area are deafened, and any sounds they create cannot be heard.

spells.name: Sleep
spells.description:
You weave a lulling spell that fills a near-sized cube extending from you. Living creatures in the area of effect fall into a deep sleep if they are LV 2 or less.

Vigorous shaking or being injured wakes them.

spells.name: Speak With Dead
spells.description:
A dead body you touch answers your questions in a distant, wheezing voice.

You can ask the dead body up to three yes or no questions (one at a time). The GM truthfully answers "yes" or "no" to each.

If you cast this spell more than once in 24 hours, treat a failed spellcasting check for it as a critical failure instead.

spells.name: Smite
spells.description: You call down punishing flames on a creature you can see within range. It takes 1d6 damage.

spells.name: Stoneskin
spells.description: Your skin becomes like granite. For the spell's duration, your armor class becomes 17 (20 on a critical spellcasting check).

spells.name: Summon Extraplanar
spells.description:
You reach into the outer planes, summoning forth a creature.You summon an elemental or outsider of LV 7 or less. The creature is under your control and acts on your turn.

If you lose focus on this spell, you lose control of the creature and it becomes hostile toward you and your allies.

You must pass a spellcasting check on your turn to return the creature to the outer planes.

spells.name: Telekinesis
spells.description:
You lift a creature or object with your mind. Choose a target that weighs 1,000 pounds or less.

You can move it a near distance in any direction and hold it in place.

spells.name: Teleport
spells.description:
You and any willing creatures you choose within close range teleport to a location you specify on your same plane.

You can travel to a known teleportation sigil or to a location you've been before. Otherwise, you have a 50% chance of arriving off-target.

spells.name: Turn Undead
spells.description: You rebuke undead creatures, forcing them to flee. You must present a holy symbol to cast this spell.Undead creatures within near of you must make a CHA check vs. your spellcasting check. If a creature fails by 10+ points and is equal to or less than your level, it is destroyed. Otherwise, on a fail, it flees from you for 5 rounds.

spells.name: Wall Of Force
spells.description:
You lift your hands, conjuring a transparent wall of force.

The thin wall must be contiguous and can cover a near-sized area in width and length. You choose its shape.Nothing on the same plane can physically pass through the wall.

spells.name: Wish
spells.description:
This mighty spell alters reality.

Make a single wish, stating it as exactly as possible. Your wish occurs, as interpreted by the GM.

Treat a failed spellcasting check for this spell as a critical failure, and roll the mishap with disadvantage.

spells.name: Web
spells.description: You create a near-sized cube of sticky, dense spider web within the spell's range. A creature stuck in the web can't move and must succeed on a STR check vs. your spellcasting check to free itself.

spells.name: Wrath
spells.description: Your weapons become magical +2 and deal an additional d8 damage for the spell's duration.

spells.name: Zone Of Truth
spells.description: You compel a creature you can see to speak truth. It can't utter a deliberate lie while within range.
